item: I felt forced to take certain actions in the game.
At times, I found myself playing the game despite not really wanting to.
The game didn't inspire any sense of mission or purpose.
I often found myself wishing I could do something else within the game.
A lot of my in-game activities felt like things I had to do.
I felt that I could not play the game the way I wanted.
I felt that I was constrained in how I could play the game.
I felt like I was being pushed through the game in a predetermined direction.
I felt pressured to progress through the game at a certain speed.
I felt like I had to keep playing the game even though I did not want to.
The game often required too much effort for certain goals.
I felt an inner conflict over engaging in the game.
I felt an inner conflict over the things I did in the game.
It feels like the things I did in the game, I did out of external pressure.
Many actions in the game were routine and boring.
I could play the game in the way I wanted.
I had the agency to decide how I wanted to play.
I could direct my own play experience.
I could make choices regarding how to play the game.
I could develop or apply different strategies when I wanted.
I could choose different strategies or actions to use in the game.
I was able to choose how I explored the game environment.
The choices in the game felt like meaningful ones.
Playing this game and doing things in it felt like something I wanted to do.
I stand behind the game and the things players do in it.
Playing the game felt like something that is authentically 'me'.
Playing the game provided experiences I really value.
I often felt that I lacked the skills necessary for the game.
I felt that the game put me in impossible situations.
I felt incompetent while playing the game.
I felt like I wasn't ever going to get better at the game.
I kept failing to accomplish tasks I wanted to while playing.
I felt that some situations in the game were unfair.
I felt helpless when playing the game.
I had doubts about being able to do things well in the game.
I felt disappointed with my performance in the game.
I felt like the game was too difficult for me.
Playing this game, I often felt stuck.
I felt its too difficult to make progress in the game.
My actions in the game had little or no impact.
There were too many obstacles in the game.
I felt a sense of growth when playing the game.
I felt that I made progress while playing.
I felt a sense of mastery while playing.
I felt I could exercise my capabilities while playing.
I felt my actions had meaningful impact within the game.
I felt a sense of achievement while playing.
I felt capable while playing the game.
I felt that I was able to achieve what I wanted in the game.
I felt that my actions in the game were effective.
I was good at playing the game.
I was able to fully use my abilities.
I felt my ability to play this game was growing.
I felt I was getting better at playing the game.
I was improving at the game.
I felt distance between myself and other players in the game.
I found the community in and around the game off-putting.
I felt alienated from others.
The community or virtual world in the game made me feel unwelcome.
I routinely felt uninterested in what happened to other players or characters in the game.
I experienced a sense of toxicity in the game.
Others in the game were unfriendly towards me.
I disliked some of the other players.
Engaging with the game, I felt disconnected from others.
I could put myself in other characters' shoes.
I felt a sense of connection with other players and/or characters.
I felt that other players and/or characters in the game cared about me.
I cared about what happened to other players and/or characters.
I felt I formed relationships with other players and/or characters.
I consider the relationships I developed in the game meaningful.
I consider the relationships I formed in the game fulfilling.
I consider the relationships I developed in the game valuable.
I felt like part of a community.
Engaging with the game, I felt a connection to others, virtual or real.
Engaging with the game, I felt I was bonding with others.
I felt satisfying relationships in engaging with this game.
